items.title: Spot Prices Wrap: Physical Natural Gas Rally Rips into High Gear
items.summary: Next-day natural gas prices powered forward on Wednesday as a barrage of fiercely cold weather fronts gripped the Lower 48.

items.title: Futures Settle: Natural Gas Bulls on Parade as Bitter Cold Drives Prices Toward $5
items.summary: Expectations for steep storage reductions in coming weeks, driven by multiple rounds of particularly harsh winter weather, powered natural gas futures even higher on Wednesday and lengthened the year’s first major rally.

items.title: MidDay Snapshot: Imminent Arctic Chill Sends Natural Gas Cash Prices Skyrocketing
items.summary: With the coldest weather of winter to date bearing down on the Lower 48, natural gas spot prices surged Wednesday as markets braced for impacts on supply and delivery of the heating and power generation fuel.

items.title: ‘Gargantuan’ Natural Gas Storage Draw Looms as Arctic Blast Targets Lower 48
items.summary: An Arctic air mass poised to plunge deep into the southern Lower 48 this weekend threatens to deliver some of the coldest weather of the past 80 years and drive a natural gas storage withdrawal that could obliterate the all-time record.

items.title: Midday Futures: Natural Gas to the Moon as Icy Forecasts Intensify
items.summary: Unsatisfied with Tuesday’s 26% surge, prompt month natural gas futures mounted another furious rally through midday Wednesday as bitterly cold forecasts and worsening production freeze-offs drove a second wave of short covering.

items.title: Market Braces for Severe Freeze-Offs, Impacts Across Natural Gas Value Chain Amid Dangerous Cold
items.summary: The brutal cold sweeping across the United States is expected to choke natural gas production, disrupt pipeline flows and upset operations at power plants and LNG export terminals as it spreads later this week.

items.title: Midmorning Markets: Henry Hub Natural Gas Spot Price Jumps Past $5
items.summary: Natural gas cash prices were trending higher early Wednesday as the appearance of freeze-offs began to tighten supply, lifting Henry Hub spot above $5 and pushing futures toward the same level despite easing Northeast basis.

items.title: Coral North FLNG Advances as Mozambique Eyes 7 Mt/y in Exports by 2028
items.summary: The Coral North Floating LNG (FLNG) vessel has successfully completed a hull launch, according to project partners, placing the project in line to double LNG exports from Mozambique in 2028.

items.title: Permian Natural Gas Price Pain Eased in 2025, but Volatility Remains Ahead of Pipeline Adds
items.summary: Permian Basin natural gas prices showed modest improvement in 2025 compared with the prior year, but the relief proved fleeting as pipeline constraints again pushed prices back into deep discounts by the fall, setting up another challenging outlook f

items.title: US Sees Big Gains in Crude Oil, Product Inventories
items.summary: The American Petroleum Institute (API) estimated that crude oil inventories in the United States saw a build of 3.04 million barrels in the week ending January 16. Crude oil inventories increased by 5.27 million barrels in the week prior. Inventories

items.title: Chevron-Led Tengiz Oilfield Offline for Another Week After Fire
items.summary: Kazakhstan’s Tengiz oilfield will remain offline for at least another seven to ten days following the fire-related shutdown announced earlier this week, extending an outage at one of the world’s most important non-OPEC crude producers, Reuters report

items.title: The Real Reason Washington Wants Venezuela’s Oil
items.summary: The timeline of the US–Venezuela conflict highlights a long-term strategy centered on securing heavy crude supplies for US Gulf Coast refineries, which are configured to process heavy sour barrels and benefit from Venezuela’s ability to deliver crude

items.title: U.S. Natural Gas Prices Surge 45% in Two Days Due to Arctic Cold
items.summary: U.S. natural gas futures jumped by more than 45% in just two days as Arctic cold is descending on the eastern United States with freezing temperatures and warnings of dangerous life-threatening wind chills.  On Tuesday, the benchmark U.S. natural gas
